meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Evan Eschliman Anshika Niraj Elyse Mancuso Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6372.

div.div:
2012 Teen Tournament semifinal game 2.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

td.p: Evan Eschliman, a sophomore from Olathe, Kansas
Anshika Niraj, a sophomore from Beachwood, Ohio
Elyse Mancuso, a junior from Omaha, Nebraska

tr.td: WASHINGTON TODAY
A RELIGIOUS CATEGORY
START IT "UP"
(Alex: Each correct response will start with those two letters.)
THE MOVIES
WE MAKE THAT!
OPERA PEOPLE & PLACES

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"Pork barrel spending" is among the "issues" at the website of this Arizona senator & 2008 candidate for president')

(Alex: Upgrade? No, I don\'t think so.)
[This ruling was reversed at the contestant interviews.]
...
(Alex: [To Evan] We\'ll accept that [upsize], but the correct term is [*].)

upselling (upsize accepted, upgrade later accepted)

ElyseEvan
')

tr.td: Elyse
Anshika
Evan
(In the first round we dealt with Washington Today; now we deal with...)
WASHINGTON YESTERDAY
THEY'RE IN THE BAND
SCIENCE & NATURE
WHO WROTE THE LINE?
AFRICAN GEOGRAPHY
8-LETTER WORDS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_3_3', 'clue_DJ_3_3_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us a video taken on the international space station demonstrating the experiment she describes.) The international space station is ideal for zero gravity experiments. Here, a knitting needle rubbed with paper creates a magnetic field, drawing a drop of water into this astronomical type of path spiraling around it

the Sphinx')
